intro: Microlicia warmingiana var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
